intro: Trachymene glaucifolia, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to theApiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, erect stems and small, clustered white or pale blue flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a bluish-gray hue, contributing to its common name. Trachymene glaucifolia is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
